content.raw:
I think it would be nice to explain here 2 things:

* the force is applied for one time step (like a hit), not continuously (like a motor)

* the force is applied in the link's frame (not the global frame)

I know you touch on the first point later, but these details should be explained early. Later, it might be also worth mentioning that changing the time step of the simulation has an (unwanted?)  effect on the actual power delivered to the link.
